page.title: 05LOWESWATER VILLAGE HALL.
page.content: The original village hall was a wooden hut. When the school closed about 40 years ago, the building was taken over as the V.H. The hall is run by a committee of about 11 members. They represent groups who use the hall. They meet 3 or 4 times a year to reveiw maintenance, fund raising and letting. The care taker lives on the premises in the old school house. An annual Garden Fete is held at the V.H. and is organised jointly with the church council. The proceeds are shared between the Hall and the church. The hall is used for parish Council meetings, dances, W.I., Whist Drives, '77 club, F.E. clases and Wedding Receptions. It is also used for craft Exhibition on Show Day, the start and finish of the Triathlon and the Horseshoe Race.
